All Classes

Class Description
AlreadyRegisteredException
This exception is thrown when a node is trying to register with an existing identifier.
App
Akka server launcher
AppTest
Unit test for simple App.
ClientActor
This class represents the client actor, which receives information from the http server and ask to the compute actor for a computation, which can be a new node registration or a request of a destination node information (ip, port, etc.)
ComputeActor
This class represents the server computational actor, which can be seen as a sort of model of our application.
DestinationNotFoundException
This exception is thrown when, during a message exchange, a destination node is not found.
HttpServer
Akka main class, which is a http server that handles all the incoming requests.
Input
It encapsulate the content of an input message which needs to be exchanged from two different nodes.
Node
It encapsulate the information about a registered node, which are basically its identifier, its ip address and its node-red running port.
NodeRedMessage
This message is exchanged when a node on client side wants to send something to another one.
RegistrationConfirmationMessage
This message is sent from the compute actor to the client one when a node registration has a successful outcome.
RegistrationMessage
It is sent from the client actor to the compute one, and contains the information about a new node that wants to join the system, which are encapsulated in the node class.
ResponseMessage
It is sent from the compute actor to the client one when a new message needs to be exchanged from two different nodes.
